document

Class GrammarEvaluation

  • java.lang.Object
    • document.GrammarEvaluation

  • public class GrammarEvaluation
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents grammar properties of the text and instruments to get them Handles the following features: - comparative and superlative adjectives; - comparative and superlative adverbs; - modal verbs; - mumber of imperative forms; - existential; - Present Simple Active; - Present Perfect Active; - Present Continuous Active; - Past Simple Active; - Past Perfect Active; - Past Continuous Active; - Present Perfect Continuous; - Future Simple Active; - Future Perfect Active; - Future Continuous;
    Author:
    Elena Khasanova

      void posAnalysis(java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.TaggedWord> taggedWords)
      Counts the occurrence of lexicalized grammar features: comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, modal verbs, existential "there", by comparing the labels in the PosTagger output with the desired ones.

      • imperatives

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> imperatives(java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.TaggedWord> taggedWords)
        Extracts imperative forms from the list of TaggedWord objects. The accuracy of the method largely depends on the output of the PosTagger
        Parameters:
        taggedWords - - a List of TaggedWord objects, output of a PosTagger using Penn Treebank POS labels
        Returns:
        ArrayList of strings - imperative forms The method needs to be revised as its output is incorrect on complex sentences

      • parsingSentence

        public java.util.Collection<edu.stanford.nlp.trees.TypedDependency> parsingSentence(java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.TaggedWord> taggedWords)
        Parses a sentence using the Stanford Universal Dependency Parser
        Parameters:
        taggedWords - - a List of TaggedWord objects, output of a PosTagger using Penn Treebank POS labels
        Returns:
        a collection of TypedDependency objects

      • posAnalysis

        public void posAnalysis(java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.TaggedWord> taggedWords)
        Counts the occurrence of lexicalized grammar features: comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, modal verbs, existential "there", by comparing the labels in the PosTagger output with the desired ones. Will be replaced with a method returning an ArrayList of these elements to be displayed in GUI in the next release. The accuracy of the method largely depends on the output of the PosTagger
        Parameters:
        taggedWords - - a List of TaggedWord objects, output of a PosTagger using Penn Treebank POS labels
